You are the program manager for your company and management wants you to identify how you'll make decisions in the program planning processes. What program management document should serve as the baseline for all future program decisions?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
From PMI's book "The Standard for Program Management", section 3.5.5 Scope Definition:
"The program scope statement becomes the basis for future program decisions and articulates the scope boundaries of the program"

B is correct answer
The document that should serve as the baseline for all future program decisions in the program planning processes is the Program Management Plan. This comprehensive document provides a detailed roadmap for how the program will be managed and includes key information that guides decision-making.

Selected Answer: B
B. Program Management Plan.
B. Program Management Plan: This is the correct choice. The Program Management Plan is a formal, approved document used to guide both program execution and program control. It integrates and consolidates all of the subsidiary plans and baselines from the planning processes. As such, it serves as the baseline for how decisions are made throughout the program, encompassing scope, time, cost, quality, human resource, communications, risk, procurement, and stakeholder management.

B should be the right answer.

questions.question_text: What percentage of communication is nonverbal?

discussion.content:
Research by Albert Mehrabian, a professor emeritus of psychology at UCLA, suggests that nonverbal communication constitutes a significant portion of overall communication. According to his findings, communication is composed of three main elements:

Words (Verbal Communication): 7%
Tone of Voice (Vocal Communication): 38%
Body Language (Nonverbal Communication): 55%
The 55/38/7 Formula, 55% body language, 38% vocal, 7% word
